Author: ziyal79
Text: This was helpful for me http://calorielab.com/foods/rice/21

Author: alessF
Text: The labels are for uncooked rice, so you have to weight it before cooking it to know how many calories are in your portion once is cooked. If you just boiled the rice it won’t change the calories (eg. 40g of uncooked rice will maintain the calories but will change the weight, that’s why you need to weight the portion before cooking it) but if you use oil or anything beside water it will increase the calories to sum up the extra ingredient you used.
